title: Dima Studitsky RTS.FM 28.10.14
description:
1.FHLOSTON PARADIGM - LIGHT ON EDGE Original Mix - Hyperdub
2.MEMOTONE - ROOFWALKER Original Mix - Project Mooncircle
3.TIMOKA- SEMBAT'S TRAVEL Original Mix -Holger
4.RIVAL CONSOLES - 3 Chords Original Mix - Erased Tapes
5.Taylor McFerrin - PLACE IN MY HEART feat RYAT - Brainfeeder 
6. Bugge Wesseltoft, Henrik Schwarz, Dan Berglundthis -This is my day -Jazzland
7.GRANDBROTHERS - NOTBRAUSE Original Mix - Film 
8.MATOM - Experiment 7 Variation Two Original - Planet E 
9.LIQUID PHONK - MISSING YOU - Liquid Phonk Edit - Farside records 
10.RECONDITE - Konter Original Mix - Innervisions 
11.DARK SKY - PURPLE CLOUDS Original Mix - Monkeytown Records 
12.TREVINO - Warmer Original Mix - Birdie 
13.Ivaylo & Slammer - Breathe Easy (feat. Renate)Original Mix - Bogota Records 
14.Eva Be - Closer Feat. Ben Ivory - Eva Be & Cle String Version - Poesie Musik 
15.Pablo Sanchez - Morning Float Original Mix - Seven Villas

Dima started playing as a DJ in the middle of 90s. His name can be considered among the best DJs of Moscow. In the fall of 2011 Dima’s remix on Jazzanova «I Can See» from their last album was released on Sonar Kollektiv and received support from Francois Kevorkian, Tokyo Black Star and Rainer Truby.
In 2012 a few remixes was also published. Among them: epic treatment composition «Lovery» from spanish guys Tucillo & Kiko Navarro on american «King Street Records» and «Welcome To My World» from Rainer Trueby on the cult Munich Compost Records.
Also Dima is a participant indie-folk-jazz project "First Sun" in cooperation with the Moscow musician Vladimir Golouhovym. Guys have two studio albums.

title: Electronica Podcast - Episode 86: Dima Studitsky
description:
Dima Studitsky is in the DJ game from the mid 90-s and can be named as one of the best DJs in Moscow. In autumn 2011 his remix for Jazzanova «I Can See» came out on a well-known Berlin-based label Sonar Kollektiv, receiving support from the likes of François Kevorkian, Tokyo Black Star and Rainer Trueby. In 2012 more remixes followed, among which was the epic rework of «Lovery» from the Spanish duo Tucillo & Kiko Navarro on King Street Sounds and a remix for «Welcome To Our World» by Rainer Trueby on the cult label from Munich Compost Records. Moreover Dima Studitsky is a member of an folk-jazz project called «The First Sun» («Pervoye Solnce» in Russian) together with Vladimir Goloukhov with whom they released two studio albums.

Follow @studitsky

title: Episode #007 Oktenk x Dima Studitsky
description:
1st hour, resident mix: @oktenk 

Our resident Eugene delivering a selection of his deep house house cuts, mellow in the beginning, groovy at the end! Prepare to swing your hips! 

Tracklist: 

1. Georgi Barrel - Biggie Calls (Original mix)
2. Vodzux - Wonder Why (Original Mix)
3. James Benedict - When You're Back (Studioheist Remix)
4. Tom Conrad - Introspective (Original Mix)
5. Purple Velvet - Trials of the Blues (feat. Lisa D)
6. Dub Striker - Falling Leaves (Ghetto Chords Remix)
7. Local Options	- Promises
8. Purple Velvet - Marble Zone
9. The Checkup - I Found House
10. Detroit Swindle - Victoria's Secret
11. David Marston feat. Jordan Rosenberg & Aubrey Nolan & Beth Aggett - True

2nd hour, guest mix: Dima Studitsky 

Follow: @studitsky

This time around we're privileged to have one of the Moscow's finest, Propaganda resident, Dima Studitsky on board. His releases on Sonar Kollektiv, Compost Records, King Street Sounds, Peppermint Jam, Deep Down Slam, Galaktika Records (just to name a few) speak for themselves. 
From Moscow through Berlin, Munich and straight into your heartcore! 
Crank up the volume and have yourselves a treat! 

Tracklist:

title: Dima Studitsky - 5/8 Radio #150
description:
We're getting a little close to the 150 number of mixes, so the anniversary mix matches the magnitude of this event, cause his author is the veteran of the DJing - Dima Studitsky.

For many years he has been a resident of Propaganda Moscow club, he has played all around Russia and far beyond, being a part of some of the best underground European festivals such as Southern Soul Montenegro, Antalya Sunsplash, and De La Bonne Musique Festival. His remixes were released on famous labels such as Sonar Kollektiv, Munich Compost Records. For more than 10 years now, Studitsky together with his partner in crime Ilya Rasskazov is running the internet-radio project called Headz.FM, and the infamous club nights of the same name, which have hosted Gilles Peterson, Ame, DJ Krush, Jazzanova, Domu, Kyoto Jazz Massive, and dozens of other outstanding DJs and musicians.

title: TAKT Mix Series 011 - Dima Studitsky
description:
Another mix woven skillfully by the hands from the capital, it is soulfully filled with captivating downtempo rhythms. Here you'll find a gentle breeze and a cozy atmosphere. So, wherever you may be, simply surrender to the moment and enjoy the next hour!

Dima Studitsky has been standing behind the turntables for almost three decades, and his sets resonate with intelligent and beautiful eclecticism, encompassing a wide range of genres from ambient, downtempo, and dub to the most current manifestations of house, techno, and broken beats. As a producer, he is highly valued and recognized not only in Moscow and Russia but also beyond, thanks to his releases on Compost Records, Sonar Kollektiv, Peppermint Jam, and King Street. In his discography, you can find remixes of artists such as Jazzanova, DJ Cam, and Radio Citizen. He has also participated in major European festivals such as Southern Soul and Sunsplash, and in Moscow, his sets could be heard warming up for Ame and Gilles Peterson, Kuniyuki Takahashi and Karizma, DJ Krush, and Peter Kruder.

@studitsky
instagram.com/dimastuditsky

Subscribe to TAKT
taplink.cc/takt.rec

title: The Russian Roulette with Dima Studitsky - 17th April 2024
description:
This April, Alex Imix welcomes a long-awaited guest Dima Studitsky to his Russian Roulette show. 

For nearly three decades, Studitsky has been weaving magic behind the turntables, playing sophisticated sets that flawlessly blend ambient, downtempo, and dub with cutting-edge house, techno, and broken rhythms.

But his talents extend beyond the booth. As a producer, Studitsky's releases on labels like Compost Records, Sonar Kollektiv, Peppermint Jam, and King Street have earned him international acclaim. His impressive discography boasts remixes for Jazzanova, DJ Cam, and Radio Citizen and many others.

Festival stages worldwide have witnessed Studitsky's brilliance. From revered European gatherings like Southern Soul and Sunsplash to electrifying Moscow crowds paying opening sets for the likes of Ame, Giles Peterson, Kuniyuki Takahashi, Karizma, DJ Krush, and Peter Kruder, he's a true master of his art. Put your headphones on, press play and have a proper listen.
